instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> OS problem
threads.message: I have this card that works perfectly the only thing that in the Monterey installation once you enter the password, it tells me that it can't install an update and doesn't keep me

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> OS problem
threads.message:
Is propably better to keep previous macOS version.
Just in case, check if accepts Ventura.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> OS problem
threads.message: I did a test with an external drive with high Sierra installed and it did the same thing, it just goes into safe mode

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> OS problem
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> OS problem
threads.message:
Try known good BIOS.
Failure in macOS upgrade caused problems many times.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> OS problem
threads.message: I try to do a restore in dfu mode, if I possibly want to replace <CHIP>U4200</CHIP> I can use a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> donor, I'm afraid that part is affected by corrosion

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> OS problem
threads.message:
Not sure, nobody mentioned such change before.
You can try...
